examples: A kilt needs about six meters of tartan.
First up is from Jesse Leahey and this is Conan in a kilt with weird fleshy octopus legs.
When a Scotsman wears a kilt, he is saying, 'I like being Scottish.'
Many of them wear kilts in the clan tartan when they come.
Not all Scots men have kilts, but more and more of them wear one sometimes, and lots of people wear kilts to the Games.
words.defineEn: a knee-length woolen skirt in tartan pattern traditionally worn by Scottish men, and more recently women in the Highlands
words.defineVi: một chiếc váy len dài đến đầu gối với hoa văn kẻ sọc truyền thống được mặc bởi đàn ông Scotland và gần đây là phụ nữ ở Cao nguyên

examples: I assure you that our company has opened our kimono about every aspect of our tax obligations to the state.
But today, founder Gabe Rivera has opened the kimono a little bit on how stories are chosen to be featured on the site.
words.defineEn: a long and loose robe with wide sleeves that is fastened with a sash, originally worn on formal occasions in Japan
words.defineVi: một chiếc áo choàng dài và rộng với tay áo rộng được thắt bằng một chiếc thắt lưng, ban đầu được mặc trong những dịp trang trọng ở Nhật Bản

examples: SARI BETH ROSENBERG, Teacher: This will be my 19th year of teaching, but, let me tell you, it feels like my first year.
Sari Beth Rosenberg:
She's wearing this absolutely gorgeous, golden, sari and really spectacular outfit.
words.defineEn: a long piece of cotton or silk that is wrapped around the body in style, forming a dress, originally worn by women in the Indian subcontinent

examples: You like plaid?
And one of those examples is Plaid.
Plaid also adds analysis on top of the bank account.
Over 80 percent of all of the biggest fintech companies now are customers of Plaid.
In fact, Plaid bought its biggest competitor Quovo in twenty eighteen.
words.defineEn: a long piece of cloth traditionally worn over the shoulder as part of Scottish Highland dress
words.defineVi: một mảnh vải dài theo truyền thống được đeo trên vai như một phần của trang phục Cao nguyên Scotland

words.defineEn: a traditional blouse worn by women in various Southeast Asian countries, typically made of sheer fabric and often featuring intricate embroidery or lace details

words.defineEn: a loose garment that covers the body from head to toe, except the eyes, worn by some Muslim women

words.defineEn: a long and loose piece of outer garment that covers the whole body, except for the hands, face and feet, worn by some Muslim women

words.defineVi: trang phục truyền thống của Ấn Độ, tương tự như áo khoác dài đến đầu gối, thường được mặc cho những dịp trang trọng

examples: She received a new pair of pajamas as a gift for her birthday.
I always pack my favorite pajamas when I go on vacation.
I like to wear comfortable pajamas when I sleep.
He forgot to change out of his pajamas before going to the store.
He's the cat's pajamas, I couldn't love, respect, admire, and enjoy that individual more than I do.

examples: He's also an active member of Emojination, a community of emoji enthusiasts that helps get many emoji proposals approved, like the hijab and the dumpling.
At certain times (like in the history of women wearing hijabs) certain hair coverings were suppressed and discouraged by governments.
Changes in hair covering can also note a change in someone’s status, like an Orthodox Jewish woman who goes from being single to married, or a hijab worn by a Muslim girl after puberty.
words.defineEn: a religious piece of clothing, worn by some Muslim women in public, covering the head and neck

examples: Afghan troops face horrific casualties.

Afghan officials know, this time, there will be no American cavalry to the rescue.
Afghan President Ashraf Ghani voiced his support for U.S. troop withdrawal, calling it a new chance for the country.
Afghan warlords and militias fill the security vacuum left by a weak central government and the withdrawal of U.S. forces.
